channel.title: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?

item.title: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
I could get out no problem. What bothered me more was the game-breaking APC that you dropped a shipping container on early on. If you walked up to it and pressed use it was a broken vehicle that wouldn’t let you get out or do anything other than load your last save.

Read full topic
item.source: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?

item.title: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?
item.dc:creator: Alcator
item.description:
raw_bean:

He just said he loved it. I did too. It reminded me of Portal, and Mr Whirly was awesome.

It might have been awesome IF it actually worked the way it was supposed. But the fact that you couldn’t get out of Mr. Whirly without using console commands was pretty stupid.

Still, besides this, I really enjoyed playing R&D. Some of the puzzles were mind-blowing.

Read full topic

item.title: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
I think that R&D is overrated. Don’t get me wrong, I loved it, it was great, it may even be the best mod this year. But I’ve heard people say that it’s the best mod ever (cough podcast17 cough) which just isn’t true. It was really good, but it wasn’t that good.

Read full topic

Also I figured out a few ways to die. lol

item.source: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?

item.title: Coolest HL2 mod so far this year?
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
I wouldn’t consider this the best mod of the year, but I’m throwing it out there since “Research and Development” has been taken and “Black Mesa” isn’t out yet.

Korsakovia was just released. It’s made by the same people as Dear Escher, but instead of just being very poetic and scenic it takes the great writing and audio from Dear Escher to make a psychological horror game. I haven’t actually beaten it yet, but so far I find it really well written and plenty terrifying. https://www.moddb.com/mods/korsakovia. If in the end it ends up totally sucking, I would at least give it some award for incredible audio and atmosphere.

Read full topic
